beans.description:
This adaptor does the following...
* reads xml from stdin * validates the xml * writes to stdout
It's intended to show you how to configured the Validator Pipe
Run it like this...
java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config validate.xml
You need the following in your classpath
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar
Once it is running it will wait for command line input
type some valid xml like this...
<data>hello</data>
...and it should be echoed to standard output
Invalid xml (or anything else) will instead be routed to the failures file.
type something which is not an XML doc with an element called data and the validation exception will be thrown. The adaptor is configured to route all failures to the configured output file.

property.name: exceptionProcessor
property.description: this routes any exception to invalid writer
